council_profile.political_control: Labour majority (19 seats of 30). Conservative official opposition (5 seats).
council_profile.transaction_profile: Moderate volume, good data quality. 30% micro-transactions under £100. COVID grant pass-through inflates 2021/22 figures.
council_profile.note: Rossendale publishes XLS format (not CSV). Data extracted from corporate spend analysis files. 19 quarters of data available.

data_quality.description_completeness: 100% — every transaction includes description and detail
data_quality.department_completeness: 100% — directorate and head of service provided
data_quality.date_completeness: 100% (derived from period numbers within financial year)
data_quality.note: Excellent data quality. Rich descriptions with both category and detail. 17 distinct departments. Only limitation: dates are approximate (mid-month) since source data provides month numbers not exact dates.

name_withheld_transparency.description: Supplier name listed as 'NAME WITHHELD' — most frequent 'supplier' by transaction count
name_withheld_transparency.note: This is a transparency concern. 7.4% of all transactions have the supplier name withheld. Citizens cannot scrutinise who receives this money. May include confidential settlements, individual payments, or redacted names.

capita_outsourcing.description: Capita Business Services Ltd — primary outsourced services provider
capita_outsourcing.note: Similar outsourcing model to Burnley/Pendle (Liberata £36.7M/£16.7M). Rossendale's Capita contract is smaller but still the single largest supplier.

agency_staff.note: Most frequent commercial supplier. £1,255 average per transaction suggests daily/weekly agency worker charges. Volume warrants review of whether permanent recruitment would be more cost-effective.

covid_passthrough.description: COVID Business Grants (£5.4M) + BEIS (£2.5M) + DLUHC (£4.1M) pass-through funding
covid_passthrough.note: 2021/22 was the peak spending year (£21.3M). Removing COVID pass-through, underlying annual spend is £12-14M — significantly lower than Burnley, Hyndburn, or Pendle.

year_end_pattern.note: 14 departments show March spending spikes — the most of any East Lancashire council. Customer Services (7.2x), Operations (5.5x), Finance (5.4x), Regeneration (5.1x). Note: earlier analysis showing '1.1x overall' was misleading — department-level analysis reveals significant year-end rushes masked by the overall average.

micro_transactions.note: Banner Business Solutions (stationery): 1,019 transactions averaging £35. Lancashire Bus & Truck Parts: 919 transactions averaging £102. Consolidation could significantly reduce admin costs.

capita.note: Primary outsourcing provider — equivalent of Liberata at Burnley/Pendle

rapid_recruit.note: Agency staff — most frequent commercial supplier

rossendale_leisure_trust.note: Leisure trust — similar to Burnley Leisure Trust

cross_council_context.outsourcing_comparison: Capita (£5.3M across 77 transactions) vs Liberata at Burnley and Pendle. All 4 councils use Capita but Rossendale is the heaviest user.
cross_council_context.data_advantage: Best description quality of the 4 councils — both category and detail provided for every transaction. Data quality score: 95/100.
